comment: In the toString() method, using StringBuilder is a more efficient way of creating a string than using String concatenation in loops, which is good. However, result += ... is still used for concatenating rows; it would be more efficient to use the StringBuilder here as well.
I would add some blank lines to separate the various parts of the code a little, because this is not very readable
I would extract this into a separate variable for clarity
Again, I would extract this into a separate variable for clarity
Extract this long condition into multiple smaller ones, so that it's easier to understand what's being checked
This method could be named better, becase "between" is a little general and it doesn't do what first came to my mind (checking whether a value is between n1 and n2)
Shouldn't the dy of north and south be the other way around? North with dy = 1 and south with dy = -1
I would personally write the enum options in full (NORTH instead of N, SOUTH instead of S, etc.). Just for sake of clarity and readability
